critique: This document is an executive order focused on immigration enforcement. It emphasizes strict enforcement of immigration laws, particularly regarding illegal entry, and aims to detain alien families together where appropriate. It also seeks to modify the Flores settlement to allow for longer detention periods. The order leans conservative on immigration and potentially expands executive power in immigration matters. It does not directly address economic regulation or social inclusion beyond the context of immigration. It could be seen as prioritizing national security (border control) over civil liberties (family separation concerns). It centralizes immigration enforcement at the federal level.
